pageContext.claim: “Perhaps never in the history of our Country has someone been more thoroughly disgraced and excoriated than James Comey in the just released Inspector General’s Report. He should be ashamed of himself!”
pageContext.analysis: The Justice Department Inspector General sharply rebuked the former FBI Director for his handling of memos he wrote about his conversations with Trump, in particular allowing one unclassified memo to be shared with a reporter. But Trump hypes up the criticism. "Comey had several other lawful options available to him to advocate for the appointment of a Special Counsel, which he told us was his goal in making the disclosure," the report concluded. "What was not permitted was the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive investigative information, obtained during the course of FBI employment, in order to achieve a personally desired outcome."
